permissions.title: Permissions

about.title: About Permissions
about.description: Permissions control what AI can do in your workspace. You can set different permission levels for different contexts.
about.workflow: Use permissions to create safe boundaries for AI operations. You can allow read-only access, require approval for changes, or grant full autonomy.

permissions.defaultPermissionsDescription: Default permission settings for this workspace
permissions.createPermissionsJson: Create a permissions.json file in your workspace to add custom rules.
permissions.workspaceCustomizationsDescription: Customize permissions for specific files, folders, or tools in your workspace.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.toolIconsDescription: Icons shown next to CLI commands in chat activity. Stored in ~/.craft-agent/tool-icons/.

notifications.description: Get notified when agent tasks complete

connection.description: How your AI agents connect to language models.

connection.customModelDescription: Override all model calls with this model ID (useful for OpenRouter, Ollama, etc.)

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.basicInfoDesc: Help Craft Agent personalize responses to you.
preferences.name: Name
preferences.nameDesc: How Craft Agent should address you.
preferences.timezoneDesc: Used for relative dates like 'tomorrow' or 'next week'.
preferences.languageDesc: Preferred language for Craft Agent's responses.
preferences.locationDesc: Enables location-aware responses like weather, local time, and regional context.
preferences.cityDesc: Your city for local information and context.
preferences.countryDesc: Your country for regional formatting and context.
preferences.notesDesc: Free-form context that helps Craft Agent understand your preferences.
preferences.notesPlaceholder: Any additional context you'd like Craft Agent to know...

modeCycling.title: Mode Cycling
modeCycling.description: Select which modes to cycle through with Shift+Tab

labels.title: Labels
labels.name: Name
labels.label: label
labels.description1: Labels help you organize sessions with colored tags. Use them to categorize conversations by project, topic, or priority — making it easy to filter and find related sessions later.
labels.description2: Each label can optionally carry a value with a specific type (text, number, or date). This turns labels into structured metadata — for example, a "priority" label with value 3, or a "due" label with a date.
labels.description3: Auto-apply rules assign labels automatically when a message matches a regex pattern. For example, pasting a Linear issue URL can auto-tag the session with the project name and issue ID — no manual tagging needed.
labels.hierarchyDescription: All labels configured for this workspace. Labels can be nested to form groups.
labels.noLabelsDescription: Labels can be created by the agent or by editing labels/config.json in your workspace.
labels.autoApplyRulesDescription: Regex patterns that automatically apply labels when matched in user messages. For example, paste a Linear issue URL and automatically tag the session with the project name and issue ID.
labels.label: Label
label
